roadmap:
Okay, here's a 6-month learning roadmap tailored to Thomas Shelby, based on his existing skills and aiming for an AI Engineer role, emphasizing free/low-cost resources and project-based learning.  It leverages his business acumen and leadership experience to differentiate him from a purely technical candidate.

**Overall Strategy:**

*   **Phase 1 (Month 1-2): AI Foundations & Python Mastery** - Focuses on building a strong foundational understanding of AI concepts and mastering Python, the primary language for AI development.
*   **Phase 2 (Month 3-4): Machine Learning Fundamentals** - Delves into core machine learning algorithms, model building, and evaluation.
*   **Phase 3 (Month 5): Deep Learning Introduction** - Introduces deep learning concepts and frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
*   **Phase 4 (Month 6): Project Portfolio Building & Job Search Prep** - Solidifies learning by building a portfolio of AI projects, networking, and preparing for job applications.
    Each phase builds upon the previous one, gradually increasing the complexity and specialization of the material.

**Roadmap Structure:**

Each phase includes:

*   **Modules:**  Specific areas of study.
*   **Resources:**  Recommended free or low-cost learning materials.
*   **Projects:**  Hands-on projects to apply the knowledge.
*   **Tasks:** Actionable steps to take.

---

**Phase 1: AI Foundations & Python Mastery (Month 1-2)**

**Goal:**  Establish a solid understanding of core AI principles and become proficient in Python programming.

**Modules:**

*   **Module 1.1: Introduction to AI & Data Science Concepts (Week 1)**
    *   **Resources:**
        *   YouTube: "AI Crash Course" by Google AI Education ([https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Gj7KNpV-YRE](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Gj7KNpV-YRE))
        *   Kaggle: Introduction to Data Science ([https://www.kaggle.com/learn/intro-to-data-science](https://www.kaggle.com/learn/intro-to-data-science))
    *   **Tasks:**
        *   Watch the Google AI Crash Course videos. (2 days)
        *   Complete Kaggle's Introduction to Data Science course. (2 days)
        *   Write a short summary of key AI concepts like supervised vs. unsupervised learning (1 day).
        *   Start using Git and Github. (2 day)
*   **Module 1.2: Python Fundamentals (Weeks 2-4)**
    *   **Resources:**
        *   FreeCodeCamp: "Scientific Computing with Python" Certification ([https://www.freecodecamp.org/learn/scientific-computing-with-python/](https://www.freecodecamp.org/learn/scientific-computing-with-python/))
        *   Google's Python Class ([https://developers.google.com/edu/python](https://developers.google.com/edu/python))
        *   YouTube: Corey Schafer's Python Tutorials ([https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL-osiE80TeTsqhIuOqKhjR5wD8jswDBqg](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL-osiE80TeTsqhIuOqKhjR5wD8jswDBqg))
    *   **Tasks:**
        *   Complete the FreeCodeCamp Python certification. (2 weeks)
        *   Work through Google's Python Class tutorials. (1 week)
        *   Practice coding daily on platforms like HackerRank or LeetCode (easy problems). (Ongoing)
*   **Module 1.3:  Python Libraries for Data Science (NumPy, Pandas) (Weeks 5-8)**
    *   **Resources:**
        *   NumPy Documentation: [https://numpy.org/doc/stable/](https://numpy.org/doc/stable/)
        *   Pandas Documentation: [https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/)
        *   DataCamp: Introduction to Pandas (Free version)
    *   **Projects:**
        *   **Project 1:** Analyze a public dataset (e.g., from Kaggle) using NumPy and Pandas.  Calculate summary statistics, clean the data, and create basic visualizations.  Focus on your business intuition to tell a story with the data. Example Datasets:
            *   "Titanic - Machine Learning from Disaster"
            *   "House Prices - Advanced Regression Techniques"
    *   **Tasks:**
        *   Work through NumPy and Pandas tutorials. (1 week each)
        *   Complete the DataCamp Pandas course. (3 days)
        *   Complete Project 1 and document your code with good comments (1 week)

---

**Phase 2: Machine Learning Fundamentals (Month 3-4)**

**Goal:**  Understand and implement key machine learning algorithms.

**Modules:**

*   **Module 2.1:  Supervised Learning (Weeks 9-11)**
    *   **Resources:**
        *   Coursera: Machine Learning by Andrew Ng (Audit for free) ([https://www.coursera.org/learn/machine-learning](https://www.coursera.org/learn/machine-learning))
        *   Scikit-learn Documentation: [https://scikit-learn.org/stable/](https://scikit-learn.org/stable/)
    *   **Algorithms:** Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, Decision Trees, Random Forests, Support Vector Machines (SVMs)
    *   **Tasks:**
        *   Audit the Andrew Ng Machine Learning course on Coursera (focus on supervised learning). (2 weeks)
        *   Implement each of the listed algorithms using Scikit-learn. (1 week)
*   **Module 2.2: Unsupervised Learning (Weeks 12-13)**
    *   **Resources:**
        *   Same resources as Module 2.1, but focus on unsupervised learning sections.
        *   YouTube: StatQuest (Excellent explanations of statistical concepts)
    *   **Algorithms:** Clustering (K-Means, Hierarchical Clustering), Dimensionality Reduction (PCA)
    *   **Tasks:**
        *   Study unsupervised learning concepts from the Andrew Ng course and YouTube. (1 week)
        *   Implement clustering and PCA using Scikit-learn. (1 week)
*   **Module 2.3: Model Evaluation & Selection (Weeks 14-16)**
    *   **Resources:**
        *   Scikit-learn Documentation on Model Evaluation: [https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/model_evaluation.html](https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/model_evaluation.html)
        *   Kaggle: Model Evaluation tutorials.
    *   **Concepts:** Cross-validation, metrics (accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score, AUC), hyperparameter tuning.
    *   **Projects:**
        *   **Project 2:** Build a classification model on a real-world dataset (e.g., customer churn prediction). Evaluate different algorithms, tune hyperparameters, and compare their performance.  Use your business knowledge to inform feature selection and interpretation.
    *   **Tasks:**
        *   Study model evaluation techniques. (4 days)
        *   Complete Project 2. (1 week)

---

**Phase 3: Deep Learning Introduction (Month 5)**

**Goal:**  Gain a basic understanding of deep learning principles and build simple neural networks.

**Modules:**

*   **Module 3.1:  Introduction to Neural Networks (Week 17)**
    *   **Resources:**
        *   3Blue1Brown: Neural Networks series on YouTube ([https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLZHQObOWTQDNU6R1_67000Dx_ZCJB-3pi](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLZHQObOWTQDNU6R1_67000Dx_ZCJB-3pi))
        *   TensorFlow Playground: [https://playground.tensorflow.org/](https://playground.tensorflow.org/) (Experiment with network architectures)
    *   **Concepts:**  Neurons, layers, activation functions, backpropagation.
    *   **Tasks:**
        *   Watch the 3Blue1Brown Neural Networks series. (4 days)
        *   Experiment with TensorFlow Playground. (3 days)
*   **Module 3.2: TensorFlow/Keras Fundamentals (Weeks 18-19)**
    *   **Resources:**
        *   TensorFlow Tutorials: [https://www.tensorflow.org/tutorials](https://www.tensorflow.org/tutorials)
        *   Keras Documentation: [https://keras.io/](https://keras.io/)
    *   **Tasks:**
        *   Work through the TensorFlow tutorials on basic image classification. (1 week)
        *   Build a simple neural network using Keras to classify handwritten digits (MNIST dataset). (1 week)
*   **Module 3.3:  Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) (Week 20)**
    *   **Resources:**
        *   TensorFlow tutorials on CNNs: [https://www.tensorflow.org/tutorials/images/cnn](https://www.tensorflow.org/tutorials/images/cnn)
    *   **Concepts:**  Convolutions, pooling, feature maps.
    *   **Project:**
        *   **Project 3:** Build a CNN to classify images from the CIFAR-10 dataset (TensorFlow tutorial).
    *   **Tasks:**
        *   Study CNN concepts. (3 days)
        *   Complete Project 3. (4 days)

---

**Phase 4: Project Portfolio Building & Job Search Prep (Month 6)**

**Goal:**  Solidify knowledge, build a compelling portfolio, and prepare for job applications.

**Modules:**

*   **Module 4.1: Advanced AI Project (Weeks 21-23)**
    *   **Project 4:**  Choose a project aligned with Thomas Shelby's interests and previous experience.  Consider:
        *   **Financial Forecasting:**  Predicting stock prices or market trends using time series analysis and machine learning.
        *   **Risk Assessment:**  Building a model to predict loan defaults or identify fraudulent transactions.
        *   **Customer Churn Prediction with Customer Segmentation:** Leverage the strengths of both supervised and unsupervised learning to predict customer churn by segmenting customers with common behaviours.
        *   **Cybersecurity Threat Detection:**  Using AI to detect anomalies in network traffic.
        *   **Develop an AI strategy:** Thomas has led diversification strategies before, so he could leverage his experience to develop an AI strategy for Shelby Company Ltd., leveraging his previous skills.
    *   **Tasks:**
        *   Define the project scope and gather data. (2 days)
        *   Develop, train, and evaluate the AI model. (1.5 weeks)
        *   Document the project thoroughly (code, methodology, results). (3 days)
*   **Module 4.2: Portfolio & Resume Building (Week 24)**
    *   **Tasks:**
        *   Create a GitHub repository for each project, with clear README files.
        *   Build a personal website/portfolio to showcase your projects.
        *   Revamp your resume to highlight your AI skills and projects.  Emphasize the business impact of your projects.
        *   Tailor your resume to specific AI Engineer job descriptions.
*   **Module 4.3: Networking & Job Applications (Weeks 25-26)**
    *   **Tasks:**
        *   Connect with AI professionals on LinkedIn.
        *   Attend online AI meetups and webinars.
        *   Practice answering common AI interview questions.
        *   Apply for AI Engineer positions that align with your skills and interests.

---

**Additional Notes for Thomas Shelby:**

*   **Leverage Existing Experience:**  Highlight your business acumen, leadership skills, and negotiation experience in your resume and interviews.  Explain how these skills will make you a more effective AI Engineer.
*   **Focus on Business Impact:**  When discussing your projects, emphasize the potential business value of your AI solutions (e.g., increased revenue, reduced costs, improved efficiency).
*   **Strategic Thinking:**  Demonstrate your ability to think strategically about how AI can be used to solve business problems.
*   **Executive Presence:** Maintain a professional and confident demeanor throughout the job search process. Your proven track record of success gives you a distinct advantage.
*   **Cybersecurity Focus:** Given Thomas's existing experience with compliance frameworks, focus on cybersecurity in the project.

**Important Considerations:**

*   **Time Commitment:**  This roadmap requires a significant time commitment (at least 20-30 hours per week).
*   **Adaptability:**  Adjust the roadmap based on your progress and interests.
*   **Continuous Learning:**  AI is a rapidly evolving field, so it's essential to embrace continuous learning.

This roadmap provides a structured approach to learning AI and transitioning into an AI Engineer role.  Good luck, Thomas!
